storyInfo: Saga shares a thrilling story with Lava while shopkeeper Dawn offers what may very well be clues to the young operator. Kroos and Mr.Nothing also rejoin the others, but before they can relax, the sky begins to change.

attributes.text: Since childhood I grew in a monastery in Higashi. Be that as it may, I was only adopted by the old head priest. I was not a true monk.
This name too, Saga, is one I only sought from him, at the time I determined I would descend the mountain and enter the secular world.

After I departed Higashi, I resolved to wander far and wide. I saw the great mountains and rivers of Yen, captivating me to linger. A childhood memory came asudden, of the day I charged in error into the head priest's garret.

In it a deal of clutter was piled, dust like snow, yet held some rarities that roused the childly heart in me. Among them, a large picture scroll most caught my interest. The box that held it, I only remember 'twas taller at the time than myself.
Only later did I happen to learn, it was the witness of all the travels of my head priest, in the times he wandered as I do now. 'Twas near a hundred meters, and a work of no renowned artist.
For half a day I implored him, and only then with reluctance did he unfurl the scroll for me.

It has been however many years. To this day, I still cannot forget the falling leaves borne down by the wind, and my still-healthy head priest opening that scroll across the monastery courtyard—I... I had never before seen such magnificent mountains and rivers.

What I do not understand to this day is how scroll was not meticulous as a true, vivid and lifelike 'masterpiece' of ordinary, yet true enough, one was there in the blink of an eye. In the late autumn season, I felt, sensed the abounding vitality of those midsummer waterfalls—

Ah, mistake not 'one was there' as an adjective of mine. In that instant, it was as if truly, in reality, I found myself in the painting, visiting as a fowl flies over the forests. Mountains risen in layers of peaks, ponds filled with pebbles, tree shadows swaying, I was below a waterfall, vast, one I could hear!

But when I dazedly returned to my senses, it seemed I was only drawn in by the painting, lost staring at it and nothing more. The fit of shivers I even had, coming from those midsummer mounts and streams back to the late autumn courtyard, lives deeper in my memories yet.

My head priest told me this painting came to him from a chance meeting, along the K'u-t'an River in Yen. At the time, he was just slightly younger than I am now, only a mere novice monk. The chieh-tu-shih patrolled the south, and the regular way was blocked, the only option to take a river ferry.

Countless sails fluttered along the river, but far in the distance he sighted a lone boat, along the riverside, as though it did not belong to this scene full of life. My head priest was curious, and followed it close.

That lone boat sailed steady, unwavering. From the other vessel he caught one glimpse of her, gazing to the zenith of Mount Sky like one would in preparation for ascent, its clouds and mists winding round. For a moment he was sheerly confounded, nearly falling into the water, and within a single breath, that person saved him.

The woman was magnificent beyond compare. She spoke not a word, taking him all along the riverside, shoring at Fei-shan Crossing, walking for Mount Hui-ch'i. Repaying her kindness for saving him, all the way my head priest made meals over fresh firewood, carried their bags and cut down the brambles, toiling day and night.

The woman seemed to never need sleep, and whenever my head priest turned in for the eve, he would dream of past events he had never seen before. After waking, he would forget them deeply, feeling as though he had dreamt, and as though he had not.

After several recurrences, he fell into prolonged thought. The two of them were clearly travelers side by side, yet appeared as if two strangers, reflecting upon themselves deep in their own solitude.

On a certain day, the two arrived at a place of graceful mountains and rivers, and it seemed to move her. She stopped and gazed from far above, watching for several hours. My head priest asked her what she was doing, and she spoke: she was painting. Painting a scroll, a scene of crude mounts utmost risen.

My head priest was compelled to a brief nap, and when furiously awoken, he realized he was still inside the boat upon the K'u-t'an River. There was never any Fei-shan Crossing, and never that seemingly transcendent woman. Only new before his eyes now was a picture scroll, holding this exact painting.

attributes.content: What was that woman called?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I know not.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: He never asked?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: He never dared.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Moreover, when dreams seem fantasy, truth seems false, when what passes is perhaps a year, yet may be a snap of the fingers—between other worlds—where should one go to ask?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Travelling the country of Yen, I inevitably find myself thinking back on this story. Poring over it, it may have only been my head priest putting on a show for me, haphazardly making up a story.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: But in my queries all across Yen, I was surprised to find this 'Scene of Crude Mounts Utmost Risen' has some small reputation.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: 'Twas said it was an obscure artist about a hundred years prior who left it, and past relatives of the Emperor could not obtain it with all their riches, giving it its fame.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: By fortune I was close to Mount Hui-ch'i, and I had the sudden thought to take this chance, to see whether or not I could find the sublime scenery in that painting...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Hah hah. I found enchanting hills and waters in the mountains, and before I could react, I had already ended up here.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: The cottage on Mount Hui-ch'i. That's exactly where we were too...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Could this place be a dream?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: If it were a dream, then to thee, I would only be its illusion, and thou would be unable to trust my words.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: If thou art unable to trust, then how dost thou judge the scenery before thee, Lava? Is it a dream, or not?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Slow down... you're gonna give me a headache...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Okay, then do you know how to get out of here?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Travelling to this day, I still have not come to understand how I may leave of my own accord.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: To this day? How long have you been staying in here?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: For a very, very long time. Allow me to count...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Your tea'll get cold soon. Don't get lost chatting; give the tea a taste.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Ah... thank you.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: (Phew...)
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Hm? Now that we mention it, Miss Dawn, don't tell me you're also...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I'm just a local pawnbroker.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Miss Lava... I really appreciate your kindness, and admire your intent to protect the villagers from the Ink Spirits, but please think more about your own safety, if you have the time.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Those monsters aren't a threat to Rhodes Island's elite.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Words without falsehood. The good Lava is a person of fine ability. You need not worry!
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: If true, then I suppose it's alright.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Miss Lava, I've got a question, and I'm not sure whether I should ask it.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Ask away. You don't really need to be that reserved with me...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Miss Lava, have you ever looked close at the moon in the water?
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: No matter how the moonlight in the water is torn apart gleaming on the waves, when all comes to a calm, it will still be that same full moon.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: If you pity the moonlight in that time it flickers across the water, then it's not at all necessary you wet your shoes and brave the cold.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Miss Lava, so as to fish up that moon in the water, would you... give your utmost thought?
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: I... I don't think I would? There's not much sense in doing things like that, is there?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: What's got you mentioning this out of nowhere?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I don't know what that bright moon of yours looks like, Miss Lava, and I have no way to point out where you're falling short. But the moon in the water, in the end, is only the moon in the water.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: It's not necessary to do it for our sakes.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: You mean...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Benefactors! My benefactors! You're alright, aren't you?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Oh, man, you even got tea going, and you still didn't call me over.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I assume these two are also esteemed guests of P'o-shan Village? I'll go brew the tea, and bring some pastries too. Take your time to chat.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: And who might this be?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: The shopkeeper here. She's called Dawn. Dawn like the daybreak.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Benefactor, what of those Ink Spirits? Oho, I see! Surely, with your invincible might, you drove them all away!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: —Is that little girl safe yet?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: She's safe. Safe and sound.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Ohh, ohh, benefactor, how could you doubt me so... I've waded through dangers extreme without shedding a tear, and now I am somewhat sad...!
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Here's your tea.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Mmm... I can tell it's expensive with just a whiff.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: How insightful, benefactor! Plain folk like me could only reckon it bitter. We'd never make sense of the taste.
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: It's just ordinary tea. They only sell this one kind in the market. Please forgive me if it doesn't suit you.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Phhaahh~ I might be used to black tea and coffee, but there's just this special kind of taste to Yen tea whenever I try it.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: My hometown also has tea whose flavor can be said to be unique. If the chance should come, thou must allow me to display my skills.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Haaahhh...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Alright there, Lava? You getting sleepy?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I'm not. I just kind of chilled out suddenly...
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Tea nourishes the heart. What troubles you can't be resolved just by rushing about.
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: We still don't have much of a lead.
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: In the world within the painting, one can only take things slowly.
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Oh, yeah! Saga, have you ever seen this thing before?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I do not know at all... Only, I know not why, but I feel I have seen this object somewhere in the past...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Really?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Allow me to think... ho... this texture... this material... I have, somewhen, somewhere, experienced it before...
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: The light reflecting off the tea...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: What's up?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Ho-hohh!? What's happening? Why is everyone standing up?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: The sky?
attributes.name: Saga

attributes.content: It's turning day...?
attributes.name: Dawn

attributes.content: Gkhaa!
attributes.name: Ink Spirit

attributes.content: H—How did these things get near here?! This is the noontime street!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: N—No, the horizon... wh... when did the sun move over there? What's happening in Mount Hung-tung!?
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Gkhaa!!
attributes.name: Ink Spirit

attributes.content: Aaaghhh! These things, they're—they're eating people—! Run, get out of here!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: ...It passes on just like this, sun rising and moon setting, as it should be.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: Does she mean... to disturb my peace?
attributes.name: Storyteller

attributes.content: What... what's happening?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Why would the sun...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: —This is how the sun's meant to be, Lava.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Huh? Well, of course I know that, yeah, I'm just wondering why it went back to normal—
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Wait. Right. This is what's normal... what I was just thinking...?
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: Benefactors, why do I sense a great commotion in the village that way?
attributes.name: Mr.Nothing

attributes.content: Help me—help me! Help—
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: Gkhaa!
attributes.name: Ink Spirit

attributes.content: Are you alright?!
attributes.name: Lava

attributes.content: I'm—I'm alright, so this is where you were, that's great, great! Those monsters just aren't afraid of sunlight anymore now!
attributes.name: Villager

attributes.content: They're in the village, ea-ea-ea... eating people!
attributes.name: Villager
